knimeNode.name: Column Auto Type Cast
knimeNode.shortDescription: Converts a column of type String to a Numeric or Date type, if and only if all entries could be converted.

fullDescription.intro: This node determines the most specific type in the configured string columns and changes the column types accordingly. The type order is to first check if the values are dates, then integer, long, double, and finally string. For dates a custom format can be specified.
fullDescription.option: This list contains the column names which will get converted if possible.

Select this option to enforce the current inclusion list to stay the same even if the input table specification changes. If some of the included columns are not available anymore, a warning is displayed. (New columns will automatically be added to the exclusion list.)
Use these buttons to move columns between the Include and Exclude list.
This list contains the column names that are included in the output table without modification.

Select this option to enforce the current exclusion list to stay the same even if the input table specification changes. If some of the excluded columns are not available anymore, a warning is displayed. (New columns will automatically be added to the inclusion list.)
Choose or enter a date pattern. (y: Year, M: Month in year, d: Day in month, H: Hour in day, m: Minute in hour, s: Second in minute, S: Millisecond)

views.view: Table view showing the column names with the final column type and the row id of the first occurrence of the final type.
